sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects the creation of potentially malicious script and executable files in Windows startup folders, which is a common persistence technique used by threat actors.
These files (.ps1, .vbs, .js, .bat, etc.) are automatically executed when a user logs in, making the Startup folder an attractive target for attackers.
This technique is frequently observed in malvertising campaigns and malware distribution where attackers attempt to maintain long-term access to compromised systems.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: A General detection for files being created in the Windows startup directory. This could be an indicator of persistence.

signature_matches.name: Installs system startup script or application
match_data: java.exe adds "C:\Users\RDhJ0CNFevzX\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Startup\FIYAT-TALEBI.jar" to Windows startup folder.

signature_matches.name: Installs system startup script or application
match_data: java.exe adds "C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\StartUp\FIYAT-TALEBI.jar" to Windows startup folder.

signature_matches.name: Possibly does reconnaissance
match_data: java.exe tries to gather information about application "Java" by registry.

signature_matches.name: Installs system startup script or application
match_data: java.exe adds ""C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.8.0_171\bin\javaw.exe" -jar "C:\Users\RDhJ0CNFevzX\AppData\Roaming\FIYAT-TALEBI.jar"" to Windows startup via registry.

signature_matches.name: Creates process with hidden window
match_data: java.exe starts  cmd.exe with a hidden window.

signature_matches.name: Creates process with hidden window
match_data: java.exe starts  java.exe with a hidden window.

signature_matches.name: Performs DNS request
match_data: javaw.exe resolves hostname "elastsolek1.duckdns.org" to IP "37.120.199.54".

signature_matches.name: Performs DNS request for known DDNS domain
match_data: javaw.exe resolves hostname "elastsolek1.duckdns.org" of dynamic DNS provider "duckdns.org".

signature_matches.name: Tries to connect using an uncommon port
match_data: Tries to connect to TCP port 4787 at 37.120.199.54.

signature_matches.name: Malicious content matched by YARA rules
match_data: YARA detected "STRRAT_Vanilla" from ruleset "RATs" in function strings data from  javaw.exe.

signature_matches.name: Schedules task
match_data: Schedules task for command "C:\Users\RDhJ0CNFevzX\AppData\Roaming\FIYAT-TALEBI.jar", to be triggered by TIME. Task has been rescheduled by the analyzer.

signature_matches.name: Schedules task via schtasks
match_data: Schedules task "Skype" via the schtasks command line utility.

signature_matches.description: Reads system information from the proc file system
match_data: /proc/stat
/proc/cpuinfo

signature_matches.description: Uses the "uname" system call to query kernel version information (possible evasion)
Executes commands using a shell command-line interpreter
match_data: sh -c /usr/lib/rsyslog/rsyslog-rotate logrotate_script /var/log/syslog

sh -c /usr/lib/rsyslog/rsyslog-rotate logrotate_script /var/log/mail.info/var/log/mail.warn/var/log/mail.err/var/log/mail.log/var/log/daemon.log/var/log/kern.log/var/log/auth.log/var/log/user.log/var/

signature_matches.description: Executes the "systemctl" command used for controlling the systemd system and service manager
match_data: /usr/bin/systemctl -> systemctl kill -s HUP rsyslog.service

signature_matches.description: Reads CPU information from /sys indicative of miner or evasive malware
match_data: /sys/devices/system/cpu/online
clean3.linJAR@0/4@0/0

signature_matches.description: Reads CPU information from /proc indicative of miner or evasive malware
match_data: /proc/cpuinfo
/tmp/.

signature_matches.description: Non-zero exit code suggests an error during the execution. Lookup the error code for hints.
